intro: Helosciadium prostratum, commonly known as creeping helosciadium, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and western Asia. It features a mat-forming growth habit with numerous slender,匍匐的 (prostrate) stems that root at the nodes. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are typically narrow and opposite, with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
